did.unittitle: Studies in early American history : A notable lawsuit :
did.abstract: Typed copy of Head's pamphlet containing a fictional story about a lawsuit over Captain Kidd's fortune between Frederick Law Olmstead and members of the Astor family.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: Studies in early American history : about 1898, A notable lawsuit :, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, November 2021.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Franklin H. Head was a resident of New York, New York.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Typed copy of Head's pamphlet containing a fictional story about a lawsuit over Captain Kidd's fortune between Frederick Law Olmstead and members of the Astor family.
